#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=1.1 .
#Text=Students ’ Cooperative Learning and Sustainable Development

#Text=Providing future generations of professionals with the skills for sustainable development relies mainly on integrating approaches and strategies into Higher Education Institutions and their systems .

#Text=Education for sustainable development , when developed in Higher Education , should enhance students to understand how their professional activity interacts with society and the environment in order to identify possible challenges , risks , and impacts .

#Text=Therefore , Higher Education Institutions should transfer sustainability competences to the teaching profession by developing curricula competences in education for sustainability , linking sustainability to both student learning and in-practice teaching .
#Text=It entails promoting student interaction and fostering relationships in socialization and learning .

#Text=Education for Sustainable Development is directed towards promoting the development of critical thinking , strategic action , and interpersonal relationships as well as collaboration , personal involvement , and tolerance for ambiguity , in which students accept uncertainty and acknowledge dilemmas .
#Text=It empowers students to change their way of thinking and to work towards a sustainable future .

#Text=How students understand what they know and how they are progressing as they develop their knowledge through reconsidering what they learn in practice is a fundamental element of sustainable education .
#Text=Education for Sustainable Development concerns sustainable actions at all educational levels , favoring the development of competences that allow people to think about their actions .

#Text=Competences integrate knowledge , skills , values , and attitudes , and a competence-based education is a type of education that focuses on the implementation , development , and assessment of competences .
#Text=Both cooperative and reflective learning are instructional practices that can activate and promote sustainable-oriented competences .
#Text=For example , reflecting on beliefs , actions , and goals are the foundations of critical thinking and analysis .

#Text=Sustainable-oriented competences also promote developing ideas and applying strategies , planning and executing projects , reflecting on risks , taking responsibility for motivating others ; all of which form the basic principles of strategic action .
#Text=Cooperative learning is an educational methodology based on small ( usually heterogeneous ) groups of students working together .
#Text=In cooperative learning , students join forces and share ideas and resources to learn something themselves and encourage other team members to learn as well .
#Text=Cooperative learning activates peer-to-peer learning , which is defined as building both sustainable knowledge and skills through interaction .

#Text=The five variables that mediate the effectiveness of cooperative learning are positive interdependence , individual accountability , promotive interaction , the appropriate use of social skills , and group processing .
#Text=Cooperative learning relies mainly on the interdependence of the students among each other , with the roles of the team members being clearly mapped out , although they can be negotiated .
#Text=The students submit the complete group task at the end of the lesson and during the final group processing .
#Text=In contrast , in collaborative learning , if this method is properly directed by the teacher , the students themselves can learn to manage the task with no further instruction .
#Text=Most important , in collaborative learning , each student is responsible for their own individual work , separately .
#Text=In general , authors see collaborative learning as a broader , more general concept covering multiple approaches on peer collaboration , among which , for example , is cooperative learning .

#Text=Cooperative physical challenges are cooperative learning activities that have a clearly defined objective and are posed as a collective ( team ) challenge in which the group , in the first stage , must resolve a specific problem by using multiple solutions and , in the second stage , reflect on the whole process .

#Text=To do so , each team needs not only to agree on their actions as a group but , more importantly , to consider and value the individual characteristics of each and every one of its members to resolve the problem posed .
#Text=While a specific response to completing the challenge may be valid for one team , it may not be for another .

#Text=Cooperative physical challenges maximize the acquisition of competences through individual cooperation in teamwork , the intrapersonal construction of professional identity , and the definition of strategic decision actions .
#Text=Cooperation is the reciprocal relationship between people or groups , which are characterized by being heterogeneous , aimed at achieving a goal through a common effort .
#Text=Cooperation is also a principle that can guarantee a more creative and sound teaching process , provided the teacher and the student are involved in the construction of knowledge .

#Text=Cooperative learning is an educational strategy in which students work together in groups to achieve a common goal that is characterized by a structure that promotes positive interdependence between the group members .
#Text=Students gain both academically and socially when they have opportunities to interact with others to accomplish shared goals .

#Text=In the process , students learn to communicate effectively by explaining the experiences in which they have been involved , and the language they learn to use to explain the experiences , in turn , helps them to construct new ways of thinking .
#Text=In addition , if students are encouraged to participate in group discussions , they demonstrate a more sophisticated level of discourse and intellectually valuable contributions .
